metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12523 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Squid before 4.9. When handling a URN request, a corresponding HTTP request is made. This HTTP request doesn't go through the access checks that incoming HTTP requests go through. This causes all access checks to be bypassed and allows access to restricted HTTP servers, e.g., an attacker can connect to HTTP servers that only listen on localhost.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12523` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid-cgi - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid-common - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid-purge - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid3 - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squidclient - 4.9-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This was fixed in 4.x by rewriting the URI parser to use SBuf. fixed in Debian's 3.5.23-5+deb9u2

criterions.comment: squid package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9-2ubuntu1').
